column4: Hello ! I am facing issues with ubuntu 9.X series... I am not able to perform any internet based connectivity
The connection seems fine, I can ping ip as well as fqdns but nothing else works
That probably is the problem.  You know your router's IP?
I tried to enter the router ip but it still doesnt work
moreover how am I able to ping google via ip or anything ?
kinja I tried name server 192.168.X.X ie my ip of router but still no luck
Did you restart networking too when you changed the resolv.conf?
what do you mean by restart networking ? I did rebooted system but no luck
You said you reboot the system (but why is resolv.conf empty?) You're on another machine?
I am using windows 7 right now
since ubuntu didnt work so I had to go back to installation of windows 7 to get on to internet
Try this --> sudo mv /etc/resolv.conf /etc/resolv.conf-bak && echo "nameserver 192.168.1.1" | sudo tee /etc/resolv.conf && sudo service networking restart && sudo service network-manager restart
what will this command do ? One more thing you said my /etc/resolv.conf is empty .. how did you see the file and more importantly does windows 7 has /etc/resolv.conf file ? :O
No. Windows 7 does not have /etc/resolv.conf -- That is for *unix. I thought you're having network issues with your Ubuntu machine?
